revisions.rev:
{{Beauty pageant | photo = [[Image:Mw2007.jpg|250px]] | caption = Miss World 2007 Titlecard | winner = [[Zhang Zilin]] | represented = '''{{flag|CHN|name=China PR}}''' | date = December 1, 2007 | presenters = [[Angela Chow]], [[Fernando Allende]] | acts = [[Duncan James]], [[Haikou|Haikou Artistic Group]], [[Mvezo|The South African Mvezo Choir]] & No. 9 Primary School of Sanya | entrants = 106 | venue = [[Crown of Beauty Theatre]], [[Sanya]], [[People's Republic of China|China]] | broadcaster = [[Shanghai Media Group]], [[Star World]] | placements = 16 | returns = [[Albania]], [[Belize]], [[Grenada]], [[Lithuania]], [[Nepal]], [[New Zealand]], [[Paraguay]], [[Sierra Leone]], [[Suriname]], [[Swaziland]], [[Uganda]] | withdraws = [[Barbados]], [[Cambodia]], [[Congo Democratic Republic]], [[Guernsey]], [[Liberia]], [[Malawi]], [[Portugal]], [[St. Lucia]], [[Tahiti]], [[Uruguay]], [[Zambia]] }} '''Miss World 2007''', the 57th [[Miss World]] pageant was held at the Crown of Beauty Theatre, [[Sanya]], [[People's Republic of China]] on December 1, 2007.<ref>{{cite news|title=Official Announcement|date=2007-05-30|publisher=Miss World}}</ref> It was hosted by [[Fernando Allende]] and [[Angela Chow]]. [[Zhang Zilin]] of the [[People's Republic of China]] won the crown and succeeded [[Miss World 2006]], [[TaÅ¥Ã¡na KuchaÅovÃ¡]] of the [[Czech Republic]]. At an official press conference called on July 7, the Miss World organization announced that the delegates were expected in Sanya by November 2. They visited a number of popular spots in mainland China and view the preparation for the [[2008 Olympic Games]]. A total of 106 contestants competed for the crown, making it the third largest edition, tied with [[Miss World 2003|2003]].
Unlike [[Miss World 2005|2005]] and [[Miss World 2006|2006]] editions, Miss World 2007 did not have "continental zones" in the selection of the semifinalists i.e. all the contestants vied for the 10 semifinals spots. Another 5 spots were for the winners of the [[Miss World Beach Beauty|Beach Beauty]], [[Miss World Sports|Sports]], [[Miss World Top Model|Top Model]], [[Miss World Talent|Talent]], and [[Beauty With A Purpose]] contests, but there was a tie in the Beauty With A Purpose contest, so the number of semi-finalists increased to 16. The format was similar to that used in [[Miss World 2004|2004]], with the exclusion of the "Contestant's Choice" award.
The 106 contestants recorded the official torch relay anthem '''Light the Passion, Share the Dream''' for the 2008 Olympics Games as a major cooperation between the Beijing Olympic Committee and Miss World Limited. The song had its first broadcast to a global audience at the 57th Miss World final on December 1.
In addition, to coincide with World AIDS Day, the pageant presented a special tribute to the fight against AIDS, with a televised speech from former South African President [[Nelson Mandela]] and the presence of his daughter and grandson, along with traditional dancers from South Africa who joined the contestants in a special song.<ref>[http://torchrelay.beijing2008.cn/en/news/headlines/n214199826.shtml 106 'light the passion' for the Olympic Games]</ref>

===Continental Queens of Beauty=== * '''Beauty Queen of Africa''': [[Micaela Reis]] ('''Angola''') * '''Beauty Queen of Americas''': [[Carolina MorÃ¡n]] ('''Mexico''') * '''Beauty Queen of Asia & Oceania''': [[Zhang Zilin]] ('''China PR''') * '''Beauty Queen of Caribbean''': [[Valene Maharaj]] ('''Trinidad & Tobago''') * '''Beauty Queen of Europe''': [[Annie Oliv]] ('''Sweden''')
===Fast Track Competitions=== ====''Beach Beauty''==== The '''[[Miss World Beach Beauty]]''' was selected on the November 10. *Winner: '''Dominican Republic''' *1st runner-up: '''Jamaica''' *2nd runner-up: '''China PR''' *Top 5 finalists: '''Lithuania''', '''Mexico''' *Top 21 semi-finalists: '''Austria''', '''Belgium''', '''Brazil''', '''Ethiopia''', '''Grenada''', '''Italy''', '''Japan''', '''Korea''', '''Lebanon''', '''Malaysia''', '''Mongolia''', '''Philippines''', '''Spain''', '''Trinidad & Tobago''', '''Ukraine''', '''Venezuela'''
====''Miss Sports''==== The '''[[Miss World Sports]]''' was selected on November 14. *Winner: '''United States''' *1st runner-up: '''Scotland''' *2nd runner-up: '''Sweden''' *3rd runner-up: '''Wales''' *Top 16 finalists: '''Albania''', '''Argentina''', '''Cayman Islands''', '''Czech Republic''', '''Hungary''', '''Iceland''', '''Jamaica''', '''Japan''', '''Malaysia''', '''Mexico''', '''Netherlands''', '''Paraguay'''
====''Top Model''==== The '''[[Miss World Top Model]]''' was selected on November 24. *Winner: '''China PR''' *1st runner-up: '''Puerto Rico''' *2nd runner-up: '''Mexico''' *Top 7 finalists: '''Jamaica''', '''Kazakhstan''', '''Trinidad & Tobago''', '''Venezuela'''
====''Miss Talent''==== The '''[[Miss World Talent]]''' was selected on November 26. *Winner: '''Ghana''' *1st runner-up: '''Scotland''' *2nd runner-up: '''Sweden''' *Top 18 finalists: '''Australia''', '''Canada''', '''Cyprus''', '''England''', '''Gibraltar''', '''Grenada''', '''Hungary''', '''India''', '''Indonesia''', '''Jamaica''', '''Macedonia FYRO''', '''Malta''', '''Moldova''', '''Slovakia''', '''Thailand'''
====''Beauty With A Purpose''==== *Winners: (''tie'') **'''Ecuador''': [[Valeska Saab]] helps people with a terrible generic skin condition called [[ichthyosis]]. **'''Hong Kong China''': [[Kayi Cheung]] helps old people and regularly works at retirement homes. She also has strong ties with [[UNICEF]]. *Top 5 Finalists: **'''Indonesia''': [[Kamidia Radisti]] helps less fortunate children with home schooling, free medical services for babies and young children. **'''Jamaica''': [[Yendi Phillips]] helped people recover from a hurricane which hit the island by organising a fashion show and music event. **'''Sweden''': [[Annie Oliv]] has for the last two years worked with a disabled person who has always been in a wheelchair and unable to do anything for herself.
===Special Awards=== *'''Best World Dress Designer''': [[Cho Eun-ju]] ('''Korea''')
==Judges== A panel of ten illustrious personalities chose Miss World 2007. They are: * '''[[Julia Morley]]''' (UK) - President and CEO of Miss World, Limited. * '''[[Duncan James]]''' (UK) - Member of the boy band Blue, now an actor and TV presenter. * '''[[Annabel Croft]]''' (UK) - Former tennis star and television presenter. * '''Ben de Lisi''' (Italy) - Renowned fashion designer. * '''Li Xiao Bai''' (China PR) - Managing Director of New Silk Road Modelling Agency. * '''Bruce Zhao''' (China PR) - Chairman of the Huayu Group. * '''[[Makaziwe Mandela]]''' (South Africa) - Daughter of Nelson Mandela, industrialist and philanthropist. * '''Neal Hamil''' (United States) - Managing Director of Elite Models. * '''Krish Naidoo''' (Ireland) - Miss World International Ambassador, entrepreneur, works with many charitable organizations. * '''Elena Franchuk''' (Ukraine) - Founder of the Anti-AIDS Foundation of Ukraine.

==National pageant notes== ===Returning countries and territories=== *'''Suriname''' last competed in [[Miss World 1981|1981]]. *'''Sierra Leone''' last competed in [[Miss World 1988|1988]]. *'''Grenada''' last competed in [[Miss World 1996|1996]]. *'''Belize''' last competed in [[Miss World 2003|2003]]. *'''Lithuania''' and '''Paraguay''' last competed in [[Miss World 2004|2004]]. *'''Albania''', '''Nepal''', '''New Zealand''', '''Swaziland''' and '''Uganda''' last competed in [[Miss World 2005|2005]].
===Withdraws=== * '''{{flag|VIR|name= American Virgin Islands}}''': Esonica Veira * '''{{flag|Barbados}}''': [[Natalie Griffith]] * '''{{flag|British Virgin Islands}}''': Leilani Stevens * '''{{flag|TPE|name= Chinese Taipei}}''': Yen Chin Li * '''{{flag|Guernsey}}''': Hannah McLaughlin * '''{{flag|Malawi|1964}}''': Peth Msinska * '''{{flag|Switzerland}}''': Amanda Ammann (competed in Miss Universe 2008 in Nha Trang, Vietnam; unplaced)
===No Shows=== * '''{{flag|ATG|name= Antigua & Barbuda}}''' * '''{{flag|Cambodia}}''' * '''{{flag|Republic of the Congo|name= Congo Republic}}''': Pupuce Ngalla Ibata, national director of Miss Congo (COMICO) affirmed that Congo will not take part in Miss World 2007. The reason being that Miss World Organization never replied to their application for the franchise. However, she will try to get the franchise next year. * '''{{flag|Democratic Republic of the Congo|name= Congo DR}}''' * '''{{flag|Egypt}}''' * '''{{flag|Honduras}}''' * '''{{flag|Liberia}}''': The Miss Liberia 2007/2008 is scheduled for November 23 of 2007, just one week before the Miss World 2007 finals takes place. * '''{{flag|Nicaragua}}''' * '''{{flag|Portugal}}''' * '''{{flag|LCA|name= St. Lucia}}''': Yasmin Walcott, national director of Miss St. Lucia World, informed that the island won't be represented in Miss World 2007. * '''{{flag|Sint Maarten|name= St. Maarten}}''': Fabiana Arnell, national director of St. Maarten Queen's competition has informed that reports about Shanyra Richardson's participation in Miss World are not true, but she is interested in taking part in future Miss World competitions. * '''{{flag|Tahiti}}''' * '''{{flag|Uruguay}}''' * '''{{flag|Zambia}}'''
==Trivia== ===Historical significance=== *'''[[Angola]]''' reached its highest position in the Miss World's history, finishing as 1st Runner-up. *'''[[Mexico]]''' placed in the finals for the fourth consecutive year, '''[[Puerto Rico]]''' and '''[[Jamaica]]''' made it for the third year in a row. '''[[Angola]]''', '''[[Ghana]]''' and '''[[Venezuela]]''' reached the finals for the second consecutive year. * 10 out of 16 countries which made it into the semifinals, were not in the semifinals last year: '''Grenada''' (1970), '''Ecuador''' (1986), '''Hong Kong China''' (1987), '''Austria''' (1988), '''Sweden''' (1993), '''Malaysia''' (1998), '''People's Republic of China''', '''Dominican Republic''', '''Trinidad & Tobago''', and '''United States''' (2004). * Zhang Zilin's victory marked the first time that an [[East Asia]]n woman has won the Miss World title.
===Contestants notes=== * '''Angola''' (Top 10 finalist), '''France''', '''Lebanon''', '''Russia''', '''South Africa''', and '''Spain''' competed in [[Miss Universe 2007]] which was held in [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]]. * '''Macedonia FYRO''' competed in [[Miss Earth 2005]]. '''Finland''' and '''Tanzania''' competed in [[Miss Earth 2006]]. '''Costa Rica''' later competed in [[Miss Earth 2008]]. '''Guatemala''' later competed in [[Miss Earth 2009]]. * '''Cayman Islands''' ([[Rebecca Parchment]]) is the only delegate who participated at both Miss World 2007 and [[Miss Universe 2008]]. * '''Dominican Republic''' ([[Ada de la Cruz]]) ended as 1st runner up in [[Miss Universe 2009]] in [[The Bahamas]] and, coincidentally, '''Jamaica''' ([[Yendi Phillipps]]) ended as 1st runner up in [[Miss Universe 2010]] in [[Las Vegas, Nevada|Las Vegas]]. * '''Guadeloupe''', '''Latvia''', '''Norway''', and '''Scotland''' (represented as the '''United Kingdom''') later competed in [[Miss International 2008]]. * '''Hong Kong China''' ([[Kayi Cheung]]) crowned as 1st runner up in [[Miss Chinese International Pageant 2008]]. * '''Philippines ''' ([[Margaret Nales Wilson]]) is a local artist in threir country and a model * '''Malaysia''' ([[Deborah Priya Henry]]) will compete at the 2011 [[Miss Universe 2011|Miss Universe]] pageant in [[Sao Paolo, Brazil]] on September 12, 2011
===Replacements=== * '''{{ALB}}''': The Miss & Mister Albania organization replaced '''[[Egla Harxhi]]''', Miss Albania 2007, with '''[[Elda Dushi]]''', because of unknown reasons. * '''{{BLR}}''': Miss Belarus 2006 1st runner-up, '''Yulia Sindzeyeva''', was supposed to compete in Miss World; however, she attended the Miss International contest in Japan, where she became 2nd runner-up. A contract with the Japanese organization prevents her from attending the Miss World contest. 2nd runner-up, '''[[Alena Aladka]]''', took her place. * '''{{CUR}}''': '''Lisaika Everitz''', Miss World CuraÃ§ao, was not accepted as CuraÃ§ao's entry to Miss World 2007 because of not meeting age requirements. She was replaced with '''Naemi Monte'''. Since Monte did not turn in the official application to the national organization before the deadline established by Miss World Ltd, the franchiseholder appointed a new delegate: '''[[Mckeyla Richards]]'''. After this action, Naemi Monte decided to file a lawsuit against the franchiseholder, Reprod, to regain the right to represent the island at the international pageant. On October 17, a jury decided in favor of Reprod, ending the dispute between both. * '''{{LAT}}''': '''[[Ina AvlasÄviÄa]]''', Miss Latvia 2006, will compete in '''[[Miss World 2008]]'''. The organization sent '''[[KristÄ«ne Djadenko]]''', a former Miss Latvia, to this year's pageant. * '''{{VIE}}''': Miss Sea 2007 as well as [[Miss Vietnam World]] 2007's second runner-up '''[[Äáº·ng Minh Thu]]''' was named by Elite Vietnam as the country's candidate at Miss World 2007. Earlier offered Miss World's ticket to Miss World Vietnamese 2007 '''[[NgÃ´ PhÆ°Æ¡ng Lan]]''', who turned it down in order to focus on her studies in [[Switzerland]].
